div.p: Lovely day– Florenc + I drove to Mansfid in the morng. P.M. went to Prep. Lecture Eve. at Desk – Snow wasting rapidly –
Eve. at Desk most of the time —
Drizzly + rainy in forenoon – P.M. less so – Mary Atkin called – but no female prayer meeting –
Ar. F. C. World – [not her handwriting]
Eve. Benj. Braun here to tea –
Still very hazy + thick – snow melting – Florence left in 1/4 2 train for Worcester –
I rep&ddotlow; alpacca Dres P.M Ella White call She is in Semy.
20" Anniversay of Mr+ Mrs Wilds's marriage –

Pleasant forenoon but raind P.M. Mr Atkinson morng text Eph. 3d l.c.10 + the 15 verses – The unity of the Chh. vry good. P.M. Com. Season. Eve. Mrs B. + I read Stanley on the Jews, after wh. wrote Mary + Will&ddotlow; –

Drizzly when we rose but after breakfast clear sky ap&ddotlow; and Mrs B. + I went to Boston We escap&ddotlow; rain tho. it fell here a little – Mrs Metcalf we found in the cars when we came out 4–35 Tran
Rainy with sleet – P.M. tho. frobidding we went to prayer — meeting at Chh. at 3 –
Evg. read Ten Years in Washington —
At my Desk much of the day —
Drizzle + rain alternating – morng. at Desk – P.M. walked to Bridget's + back– Eve. got ready for prar meeting but no bell – so read Ten yrs in Wash

Hazy morng. + drizly till noon when the clouds broke + clear Sky — Mrs B. + I drove out thro. Neck woods – At 3 went to prayer meetig at the Chh. Eve read "Ten Years in Washington" Letter from Sister Mary —
Bright + lovely – the first Sunshine this year – Mrs B. + I drove to Mansfild to get tin left for repairs – Bad roads – muddy – a letter Mary Abbie –
P.M. Fem. prayer meeting – Mrs Wild + Abbie Goodwn –
Eve. meetig at Chh Seminarists there.
P.M. we went to Chh. to the last day of prayer meetings
Mrs Beane headache all day + at home – I went out + Mr Alkinsn very interig – Isa 45=21 a just God + a Savior–
I with my class –
Mrs B. went with me to Bos. I sold some 5/20's + Gold – + Got Certificates of Deposits for new investments Retd at 5 1/2 Tain Mr Wild went with Hay to Mason's Farm –

Fine winter day but. Cold – Mrs B. went with me to Providenc via Bar. Station – To make Deposits – Home at 3 P.M. Dr Hamlin rode up with us to the Atkinsons – Eve. he lectured on Turkey – in Un. Chh. Mr Wild went with Hay to Mason's Stock Barn
Snow came in rapidly – 11 in deep at 8 am + continued till noon – perhaps 16 or 18 in deep –
Rev. Alfred Emersn came in 3 Train about T. Br.R.R. to pass the night
Cold + clear —
Mr Emerson left in Early Train for Bos. to attend[inkblot under the d] the Taun.Br.R.R. meeting.
Snow deep + sleighig not trodden –
I've worked on my Cloth Cap – remaking it –
very cold + bright I worked on my cloth cap in forenoon – P.M. A.P.G in to prayer meeting – after wh. I walked with Miss Carter awhile – Then called on Mrs Metcalf –
Quite cold– Charly Lane came down to Settle at 9 1/2 –
Mr Wild went to Masons Stables with Hay – P.M. I went out + called at Mr Storirs – Mrs Barrows Mrs Rogerson's + the cottage –
very cold but quiet Moderated very fast by noon 28° a.0.
Glorious winter day We went to Chh. Text Heb. 11–25 4 to 26 inc. – P.M. Faith of Moses–
Eve. Mr Atkinsn spoke from Goliness profitable for this life as well as that wh. is to com.
Mr Wild went with me to Rosey's No. Dighton – in sliegh Weather was hazy but before we got home it began to rain fine – I've sent off stove to Rosey – She is vry feeble —
Pleasant – Left in 11 1/4 Train for Uxbridge via Prov. ard. ther in 3–10 Train – Found Friends well and Glad to see me.
Snow in fornoon P.M. turned to haze + Drizzle – I dined at Adol
Mrs Jeni Boynton of Chicago came to see Mrs Bean at our hous yesterday + left this Eve. with her little daugh
Still drizzle – till towards noon I called at Mary Seagram's – + at 12–25 took Cars for home arvg. Safe at 5 1/2 train –
Still drizzly + sloppy till late P.M. Mrs B. sick all day with headacke – Mr Goodw came to Tea + pass the night to assist in recit singing at concert at Semy.
Mr Baxter read – I went to Semy. not to B.H. — I sat up till near 12 when ready to get into bed –

Lovely day – Mrs B. and Mr Goodwn left in Early train for Boston – Mrs B. going to meet Nillie + Floren in Boston – I rode to Depot when Mrs B. was car&ddotlow; down afterwd went to P.O. Geo. White here putting on double window in P.M I had Nellie Burdett+ Cons. Mr + Mrs Atkins + Miss Bruer + Miss Ridle Maggie out at Eve — Geo. went to Taunton

High wind and Seemed very cold all day — I went to Chh. morng. + P.M. morng. text Prov. 3,9– Systematic giving – P.M. 2 Cor. 5–1– Sermon on the death of aged ones in the Chh. very good – Mrs B. away for the Sab– Sexton Sick + no Eve. Service – Miss Mellus called after meeting
I went to Bos. 1/4 10 Trn Mrs Geo. Perry went in too – Mrs Beane came out in noon Train – I bot. Rubber Boots +c for Cyn. + May
Moderated very much + by Eve. Sprinkled a little – morng. went in + helped Cottagers for Socable wh. came off from 4 to 9 1/2 – Pleasant Eve.
Drizzly day – I headachy — but keep off the bed –
Made pillow cases on Machine for Hom Missionary Box + then at Desk –
A clear day and bright – Fast + prayr for Colleges —
Mr Blake came up in the P.M. + Mrs Beane added the Young Lades in the morng.
After attendingatting Mr Blakes meeting Mrs B. + I rode to Mrs Drake's in Easton + Eve we went to vesty to meeting –
Geo. went with Hay to Taunton —
Maggie had sick head ache I calld at Dr Rounds + Mr Stong P.M. Mrs Atkinson + Mary into prayer meeting — After which I went to walk + call Mrs Wild's Mrs Henry Hunts + Mrs Sanford's —
Rosey 's gave birth to a Dughter this morng.
Stormy morng. cold tho. snowy in forenoon –
P.M. Mr Wild went to Taunton with Fam + Cans for Kerosene –
Mrs Metcalf was was in in the P.M. and sat an hour or two–

Still cold– We all went to Chh. Maggie to hers in the morng. Mr Alkinsn morng Sermon on System giving + P.M. Mal. 3–10 on bring in the tithes into the store house – No Eve. meeting – I wrote Cousin Mary + Han. Baylies.
0° at 9 1/2 Eve.
On rising – but a very raw air + tried to Snow but too cold I rep&ddotlow; Boots +c in forenoon – P.M. wrote 2 letters —
Very Stormy in forenoon from Snow &longequal; P.M. rain + sleet — Mrs Metcalf came in to dine + talk over Semy. matters Eve. we read "10 yrs in Washington
Pleasant – Maggie washed – Mrs B. did various things in the kitchen –
P.M. after writing Letters – Mrs B. + I called at Mrs Caswell's Mrs Beach's Miss May Rogerson's + Mr Freeman's –
Eve. Mr Rogerson call by my request to talk over Semy. matters [underlined to separate from next entry]
Clear + Cold – Mr Wild logging Mr Cobb calld + Miss Mellus this forenn P.M. called at Mr Talbot's with Mrs Wild also at Mrs Hunt's + then I calld at Mrs Tafts –
Eve. we went to Chh. vestry to meeting.
very cold mong but moderated to 18 or 20 above 0 by noon – A bright day – Geo. still getting logs to mill –
P.M. Fem. prayer Meeting – after wh. Mrs B. + I walked to Con's with Xmas gifts at this late day — 6 children + oldest not quite 11 – Eveg. wrote —

Snowing all forenoon but held up middle of P.M. I at Desk on farm &account; – Miss Stantn called to bring Telescope papers – I sent Geo. to Taunton about the matter – Danl. S. Cobb called in the P.M. about Note of hand to Mr Atkinson –
Bright but cold – We have leakages from Evestroughs filling with ices – Geo. attempted to open them –
Mr Atkinson's morg text. Luke 8–18– h.C
P.M. John 7–17"– Good – Rev. Geo. Allen + wife there[them?] in the P.M. – Eve. at the Seminy at Monthly Concert — Madagan

Beautiful day – went to P.O. + Cottage – in morng. P.M. I drove Blky with Mrs B. for com pay to Sabin Tucks + left 25. with his wife for the Methodist Chh. then on returning drove to Depot Shed + walk&ddotlow; to Mrs Perry's and Sat 1/2 hour
Very raw wind – Mrs B. + I rode to Lane Bros. for Beef Roaster –
PM. at Desk after writing to Bro. Austin — and Eve. made up a pretty careful Estimate of framing[?]
Pleasant Mrs Pery + Son's wife here to spend the day + Son to dine — I enjoyed it – Eve. Miss Stanton in to bring Bill Lading of Telescope – Mrs B. went to vestry meeting + Maggie to a dance —

Lovely day – Mrs B. + I went out Sliegh riding Some 5 or 6 miles – Miss Briggs + Miss White Elocutionist here to tea after wh. we all went to hear Dramatic Reader Burbank read in Un. Chh. He read the New Organ[?] = James OBrien – Rip van Winkle + Mark Twain *** on death of fi**

Beautiful morng. of great redress– but soon overcast. Snow melted wonderfully fast. P.M. It began to rain – in the midst Mary Atkinson came in + Lizzie Wild – to prayer meeting – After wh. Mary A. staid by request + showed me her route in the old world
Morng. cleard off + Mr Wild went to Taunton – retd in 1/4 2 Train – P.M. I calld at cottage – Miss Mellus Some better –
Frances Henshaw called in forenoon –

Pleasant + mild + mudy[?] We went to Chh. Mr Atkinson's morng. text Sermon was on Ex 12 Chp + James 1 Chp. Good P.M. Ecl. 11.3 If this tree fasteth +c. Solemn Sermon – Eve. we went to Chh. Mr A. read acts. of revivals in Scot. + St. Louis. –
We busy in gettig ready for friends tomorrow – Adams Cleared up the cellars and got in Shack wood +c – Mr Wild went to Boston about his stove —
Clear + cold —

Geo. went with Hay to Mason's Mr + Mr Emerson came in 12–10 Train to visit + for us to settle on plan. A letter from Mary Lynch + Owen saying Rosey was worse – Mr Cobb in P.M. to plan – Eve Sociable at B.H. We did not go. Eve Florence came –

Lovely day – we all busy on Semy. Plans in forenoon Tidings from Rosy that she was very low– I left the Emersons + B.H. plan + with Mr Wild drove to No. Dighton but found Rosey died at 11 1/2 clk. morng. + she lay looking Sweet lovely in death–

Lovely – about like yesterday for mildness – Mr + Mrs Emerson left this morng. in Mr Babbitt calld to pay his mother's rent – P.M. Mrs B. Florence + I drove to Mansfield to get flowers for Rosey's coffin – We went to Mr McC.'s with them but they wer gon + left them with Mrs Hary – Eve we went to meeting –

Cleard off from drizzle of last night + Maggie went to Rosey's funeral – at Taunton – I drov with her to Depot + then Mr Hary[possibly Harvy] – – Mrs Metcalf vry sick – taken last night – Female prayr meeting P.M. – Eve. a postal card says Dr H. Baylies died on 17"
Mild + drizzly forenoon – P.M Dryer atmosph I wrote 4 letters – + mailed – then called at Cottage B. House – Mrs Wild + Chloe Braman's – + heard Benj.'s letter + saw his Picture –
Mr Atkinson's text morng. Psl. 147–20 v. a national Sermon worth hearing – I w***d the House was packed. P.M. he He gav us a tempernc sermon – Rom. 14–21. — Drizzly day – No Eve. Meeting
Warm – up to 58° in P.M. – Laban began his work –
Florence left 1/4 of 2 for Worcester – after wh. Mrs B. + I rode to Mr Mc.Cabes – Eve. Maggie out
Cloudy + raw – Two Furnace men from Bos. are here overhauling our Furnace. + we are in Ding. Room —
Mrs B. + I are reading 10 yrs in Washington –
Colder – Comd. snowing about noon. and is falling fast. Furnace men left here in 1/4 2 train –
Patrick Cronan called in P.M. + sat an hour. He brot. the Baby to Mrs McCabe's
Furnace unpleasant from red lead–
Prep. Lecture at 3
Patrick came in PM. – in trouble about demands made on him – Mrs B. + I went to Taunton in the morng. saw Dr Blake
P.M. Female prayer meeting–
Geo. went to Taunton Mason's Stock Stable with hay – Sleighig in Taunton
Geo. went to Taunton + recd. pay for Hay.
Very busy – Settld with Geo. + others + went prepard for Boston Miss Susie Pratt + Ellen Beane came at Eve —
Pleasant – Mr Atkinson faithful as usual – Mrs Wild + Miss Griffin recd by Letter to the Chh. Susie Pratt here to commune with us. –
Mrs B. went with me to Boston – I went to my vault and then to Banks – Bot. Mary Chapin silk dress – + did other business – Home at 5 1/2 –
Mrs McCabe here in Morng. to see me but in my absence unbosomed[?] to Maggie –
Mrs McCabe called + relievd her mind about Patrick Wheatons here for 5 6– Telescope came this Eve.
Eve. Sister Mary came – at 9 1/2 Mrs Emerson came.
Mild + pleasant rainy Mr E. wrote in the morng. + P.M. worked on Bdg. H. Plan –
Mr Emerson + Mr Cobb went to take measurments at B.H.Ding room –

Bright + pleasant = Forenoon on plans for new house – Over to Bd. House to See Mr E. measure some rooms – He left for home in 1/4 2 Train – I drove out + in from Depot 3 times for fresh air – with the Ladies – Eve. Sister + Mrs B. went with me to vestry meeting. 2d coal used
Mild – 2d coal used –
P.M. Mrs Barrows only in to fem. pr. meeting –
Eve. Rev. Dr Wallace at Seminy – but none of us went –
Snowed in morng. some – Sister Mary left in first Train for home. Mrs B. + I walked down the Lane – with Carl for Exercise – P.M. at Desk very busy–
Mrs Seabury Lane died to day –
I wrote Sam. to get me a farmer–
Pleasant– snow melting very fast– Nearly gone at noon. Mr Atkinsons morng. text Matt 22&draise;5f. c Earnest
P.M. 2 Cor. 5–13– to the Chh. = tender + Earnest – Eve. he spoke on 2 Cor.C– 1+2 – I went alone – Mary Atkinson walked home with me.

Pleasant– morng. look&ddotlow; over my Desk Mrs Sanford (my Sab. Scholar) called + I talkd with her – She is unbelieving– No Saviour in Jesus – only a lovig Father – At 1. P.M. attended Mrs Seabury Lane's funeral – After wh. Mrs Met. Nellie Plympton, Miss Mellus + Dea Saban Tucker called – Eve. read Mad.. Sermn–
Raw, cold mong– and difficult to heat the House considring the temperature –
Rev. Mr Emerson came in 3 P.M. Train

Snowy by squalls – disagreeable day. Comtt. on B.H. plan met to day – Misses Chase, Blake Emersn + Rogersn present – [large bold print-] Charles Sumner – died[end bold] ths P.M. 3, o'clk – agd 63 – Mr Emerson ret&ddotlow; home in 5 1/4 train. Geo. took him to Depot –

Very raw + cold we (Mrs B., Nell. + I drove round thro. neck woods by – Cath. Chh. Cop. works to Crane Road hom – Tedious facing wind – P.M. I sewed on Machine after going to store to see Georgia + Mr Rog. about Sam. to Cottage– to B.H. a moment – wh. caught fire in the morng —

Vry cold Early but moderated – We (Mrs B. Nell. + self drove in forenoon to Danl. Cobbs– callig at Mrs Atkins Door – to Enquir for health of Pastor — We rode around thro the neck woods – P.M. Females pray meeting – Eve– Mr Cobb called. Dea. King at Semy. Eve. meeting

Pleasant day – I expected Dea. King to call but he was obliged to return to Prov&draise; – I sat in my Chamber in forenn wrote Mary Sister + a letter on Busins + sewed – P.M. took George Sr. + Laby to Depot for Taunton to buy Shorts – Harvey +c Nellie, Miss Mellus + Carter rode with us around Copper W. + Crain road
Morng. text of Mr At. Isa. 1–3 v. l.c.
P.M. give us this day our daily bread – I out all day + at Eve. went to Smy to hear Miss Coth —
Pleasant

Eve had Mrs Metcalf Miss Brigg, Susie + Nellie Plympton + Miss Mellus to tea – Miss Smally + Carter unable to come – Mrs Metcalf in at 9.mong. to see Alvan C. Clarke from Cambridge came at Eve. to open the Telescope + give directions about putting it up –
Drizzly + gentle shows at times – I wrote Dea. King on Semy Subjects – Had a letter from Mary on offer of School in Uxbridge–
To Tea had Misses Stanton, Pike, Kilham, Bruce, + Mary Atkinson – + passed the Eve –
Drizzly day – have felt tired – wrote 3 letters in forenn P.M. took a nap– Rox A Cowles here to Tea – Eve.Mr Babcock lectured at Seminy on the crusades– We so tired did no go –

Drizzly + sprinkling by spells – I finished up the Farm book and 20 of 3 P.M. we took Maggie to Depot for Taunton + then went to Bridget's + Mrs Knowles + Mrs James Wrigley's – Danl. S. Cobb called to let me correct
Pleasant – We drove in forenoon to Isaac Blandins + round Timothy Plain – P.M. wrote Mary Chapin – Female prayer
Eve. musical of Miss Smally's
Mr Atkinson Earnest morng. P.M. + Eve – His soul moved about Butter –
Morng. text "In the Spirit on the Lord's Day" very good —
Eve Mrs B. who had had headache went out
Chilly– Mr Emerson in 1/4 of 5 train
I recd. letter from Dea. King —
Very cold– Examination – wh. I went to and Enjoyed –
Mr Plumb, Blake Barrow's + Emerson + Rogerson compd the present members of the – Mr Em. left in P.M.
Mary Chapin came at noon to our Surprise + joy –
Softend som by by noon so Nell. + Mrs B. wnt with me to Fox. to see Ema Shermn just red&ddotlow; from Europe – We had a pleasnt drive – Mary + Nell went to Miss Carters to tea –
Pleasant – morng. took Mary Chapin to Depot and then rode to Neck woods with Ellen
At noon Ema Sherman came —
P.M. after listning to her interesting talk I rested by nap– Mrs Metclf came to tea —
Pleasant – took Ema + Ellen to DepotDepo + then Mrs B. + I rode awhile – Ellen is soon to go to Milford to teach again –
At noon Thom. Jeff.n Gusher ar&ddotlow; to work for me.
Temperance Meeting P.M. but I did not go –

Snow to the depth of 3 or 4 inches in fore noon – Fair weather P.M. + snow almost gone – Rode in morng. with Tom. to Mrs Freem + Mrs Boyntons – about board– Tom went to Mrs B.s at noon– P.M. Mary Alkins + Mr + Mrs Beach + Mr Rogerson called –

Pleasant tho. rather cloudy morng. Maggie went to Meet Mr Alkinsons morng text 1 Jhn 5–1– P.M Eph. 2–1 f. C. I suppos they were both good but I was so Sleepy that I nearly lost them – No Eve. meeting – Beautiful moon – Mrs B. + I Sat in my Chamber with out a light —
Pleasant + grew mild 50da.0. Mrs Briggs here cleaning Mrs B's room + Parlor chambr Mr Cobb calld in the morng.
Mr Emerson cam in Bos. train about Telescope. Mr Cobb in at Eve.
I went to Boston Met Mrs Metcalf at Mansfield — we went to See about Settees– tables + chairs for Semiry —
Mrs Bean went with me to Boston I invest 3/4 of rent and did other business —
Mrs bot. her a silk dress —
Fast day – I tired but went to meeting Mr Alkinson had a good Sermon on pray –
P.M. I went to Bd. House + Saw Mrs Mecalf – then called at cottage
Blustery day — Mrs Beane went with me to Fall Riv Savg. Bank after wh. we stopd at Mt. Hope House
Patrick Cronan came when i ret&ddotlow; + I gave him Rosey's Bk. Bk – + a check for Rosey's grave stones –
Mrs Wild here to tea – I vry tired –
Vry tired – but went to Desk and worked till 3 P.M
Geo. gone to Taunton
About 4 P.M. drov out with Mrs Bean Very Cold –
Pleasant – Beautiful flowers at Chh. + a precious Sermon on Christ – Rev 1–18 I was in S.S. but staid at home P.M. – No Eve Service —
Stormd in the night but was pleasant thro. the day – I went to Bos. alone + attended to Bankig. business – Home at 3. P.M—
Stormy – at home – Mended Some + at &account; Books Some —
Mansfield news out this day –
Geo. went to Boston Bot. Cong. Lead + tried to Sell vinger P.M. Mrs B. + I calld at Mrs Sturdy's + Charly Lane's –
Eve. Danl. Cobb – + Geo. in on business + Mrs Metcalf – I very tired —

div.opener:
Go to Ux. via Boston –
Thursday, April 9, 1874.
div.p: Stormy morng. but Mrs B. + I went to Boston – took carriage + drove to places of busness – Removed Deposits from 5 Ct. Savings Bk. for Self + Owen McCabe – After business over and dinner at Parker's I left Mrs B. and took cab for Hart. + Erie Depot – Met Jud + came with him to Ux – [to Ux on dateline of next entry]

This morng. Snow + Sleet – dreay – Judson dined at Adolphus' + left in 5 Train for home. Mary Abbie + I went to Depot to See him off – + then walked calling on Mary Fox– M.A. stop&ddotlow; to Tea + Eve. at Aunt Mary's –
Pleasant forenoon I walked with M.A.Chapin to Cemetary + then with Sister Mary about the grounds – P.M. at 3 went to Adol. for visit till Eve.
Rainy P.M—
retired Early to my room –

div.opener:
20° a.0 – at noon rose to 30d
Sunday 12
div.p: Clear + Cold + winding I went to Chh. morng. + P–M. = A Mr Robie of New Iswich N.H. Preachd Mr Biscoe being present in feeble health. morng. text Ex. 32–19"– "Moses anger waxed hot +c – very good serm P.M. Matt. 19–14 Suffer little Children +c — Good– but no children to hear –
Pleasant tho. cool. walked to office with Mary Chapin– P.M. went to School House to see Mr Eaton about teaching Mary Latin – Eve. he called at Adol –
Had at talk with M.A.C. –
Pleasant – Milder – M.A.C. called and we walked to Mary Fox's with Sister Mary – I returnd + packed + at 12–20 took cars for home via Prov. Cynthia sick with dizzy head
Drizzly in P.M. morng. at Desk makig up my Books and bal. &account; – P.M. Mrs B. + I rode in the drizzle around Barrow's Ville + Jewlr Shop –
Peggy called P.M.
Pleasant – Dr Blake here with plans – I called on Mrs Metcalf —
P.M. Misses Mellus + Carter called with me on Mrs Ames – We then rode roun Bar.Ville –
Eve. to Vesty meetig – Mr + Mrs Alkinson called after meeting.
Went to Boston in Early train (+ out at noon) – to get Winter St papers at noon began to Storm – rain + sleet —
No Prayer meeting –
at Desk most of fore noon –
Fair Weather –
P.M. I went to Mr Short to Sign Lease of Hotel + he declind — after wh. Mrs B. + I rode round Crane + Cop. W. road Mrs Met. in at Evg –
Dull leaden Sky in morng. but sun came out – Mr At. morng. Christ in you the hope of glory – P.M. Rev. 22. 17 both good – I had 11 in my S.S. Class.
I did not go out at Eve. Meeting –
I had plan&ddotlow; to go to Fall River to see Mrs Young but it is a Stormy rainy day.
P.M. Misses Mellus + Carter called
Eve. Mrs B. + I went to Semy. to hear Mrs Baker on Physiology – subject "the skin"

Clearng off– Geo. went to Bos for fortilicuss[?] – Mrs Beane and I drove out toward Calvin Hunts Trustes Meeting – Mr Emerson here to dine Dr Blake called – Mr Chase was out – S.A.Williams Ins. Agt called about Winter St. Policy – Eve. Mrs B. + I called at Mrs Atkinsons + cottage –
Mrs B. + I went to Fall River to see Mrs Young + try to interest her in the Seminay –
We dined at Mt. Hope House – returning met Mr Wethrell formerly of Taunton + Col. Al – Hodges –
On the bed with sick headache till into P.M.
Rainy day –
Mattie Brigham Chase called.
Raind in the night but the sun struggled out to light + was pleasnt – I am rid of my Head ache – P.M. took Misses Mellus + Carter to ride. Eve. a reception by the Psyche – but I did not go –

Cloudy forenoon + about noon began to Snow + continued till near night – The ground cov&ddotlow; + trees laden with the snow – Maggie left in 1/4 of 2 Train to visit Webster – I rep&ddotlow; skirt +c – a letter from C. Sawyer.

Raind in forenon Few at Chh. more in P.M. as it cleard off – Mr Alkinson read a Sermon on Be not Slothful in business – but fervent in S. +c – P.M. Colos. 4–71.74 Both good – I Enjoyd the service – It seemd lonely at home to have Maggie away –
Fair weather – I was busy after breakfast Somtm then went to office aftr H.A. Cobb had talkd about Smy. Furniture – at noon Mr Emerson came to see about Telescope
Bright morng. but clouded toward noon + by 3 or 4 began to rain – I busy at Desk P.M. —
Drove morng to Bridgets + Austin Messngers—
Heavy + continus Storm – I went to Bos. with Mrs B. to attend to Bank&gdotlow; business = Took carriage by the hour – I cam out in 2,o'clck. TrainTan + Mrs B. in 4 1/2 Train
I made up my Books after I ret&ddotlow;
Cloudy, chill + windy – I went to Taunton to deposit in Taunton Savg. Bank – Maggy ret&ddotlow; at noon –
P.M. went to Chh. meeting – Prep. Lectur "that ye be like minded" was the text – Good – Cyril Sweet present + spoke– Olir Titus + Wm. Knowls cut off from the Chh.
Fair day – I at Desk much of the day – morng. went into Smy. + heard Histoy Dis. went to P.Off. P.M. went at for Floren + to Bridgets for wash– Flor. came at Eve Train.
Cloudy – Mrs B. + Flo. I took to cars at 8–1/2 for Compton then took Mrs Metcalf to ride – then Saw Adams Set Chrisanthems + Start on Box border – P.M. Mrs Charlotte Wild cald –

Pleasant – Mr At. morng text – P.M. spoke from the words "Sir we wld. see Jesus" John. 12–21 – P.M. was Com Seasn Mr + Mrs Hussy were recd. into the Chh. by letter from Centrl Falls – I had a large Class = 12 –
Mrs Met. came after Church + Misses Mellus + Carter calle&draise; after they left Mrs M. + I had a seasn [dateline of next entry] of prayr

68&linedeg; a.0– Warm – + pleasant – morng. out to See about Setting out Reading Shrubry – +c – Saw Mr Rogerson + Em. Tittus – P.M. I took the two last + went to Chilsons Straw work + Rogersos Eve. Miss White called after wh. I wrote –
Attended to household duties – Churnd – then went to Office – Looked after Plants
At Six went to Mrs Atkinsons with Mrs Metcalf + Miss Townsend to tea —

Pleasant Suny forenoon – P.M. cloudy – morng. work&ddotlow; over butter then to Office – then read paper +c – Mr H.A. Cobb called + sat half an hour – after wh. I took Misses Mel– + Carter + went E. Mans. to See Julia Raymond + Mrs Charlotte Pierce — + then to Mrs Jole's – All to talk about the Parsay Girls

A little sunshine but mostly cloudy – I bng at Desk a good deal – Tired myself in putting up curtain in my Room Jerry Bassett here repg. [something raised here] I finishd letter to Mrs Halliday – went twice to P.Office – S.A. Williams called on Ins. business Misses Wells – + Miss Vicy[?*] + Cochran called this P.M.
Cloudy most of the day – a little showry I went to Depot at 1/4 of 2 Train + again 1/4 5 for Mrs B. + Flo. comg from Little Compton —
Cloudy – I at Desk nealy all day – looking over Winter St. Estate papers Policies +c —
Took Floren to Depot 1/4 2 for Worcestr
Pleasant + very wam Mr Atkinson text Matt. 11–12 morng + P.M. It was Earnst + severe Some of it. Said he cld. count the number of Energet in persons on his fingrs of one hand —
Mrs B. + I went out at Eve. Willie Rogerson there + played the Melodis
Cloudy morn but cleard off – Mrs B. – + I were carried to Lane's Depot + took Cars for Prov. – after doing bus. then we went to Boston + did business there – + home at 5 1/2
Pleasant – Very whit frost – I busy at Desk in forenon Mrs Babbit calld Miss Mellus —
At One[?] went to Cal. Hunts funeral then heard James T. Field on Fiction + their authors – Eve. wrote Warn Kempton
Warm + pleasant – Mrs Briggs here cleaning windows + piazza – Forenoon settled with Charly Lane – Then took Mrs Metcalf to ride – She ret&ddotlow; to dinner –
P.M. began on Returns for Taxes – –
Geo. went to Mansfield for Tomatoes —
Pleasant + warm – Busy about preparations for Vestry – at 1 P.M. We went there + met Some Ladies + Several Gents – to clean up –
Pleasant – Geo. went to Attleboro with Hay – I chasg[?] after a Whitewashe for vesty – finally obtained Jennings– I became very tired –
Began rainng in the night + raind all day – Geo. went to vestry to clear out Chimines Mrs Briggs, Jenings, + Reed there —
P.M. Geo. went to Taunton –
Lovely day – Mr Atkinson morng. text Eph. 6–10– Be strong in the Lord + — P.M. Psl.87–2 + 102–12+13 – Good –
Mrs B. went to 3d service[?] without me –
Lovely day till 2 P.M. when it began to cloud + sprinkle – I went to vestry 1/2 Doz. times to look after work Mrs Briggs cleanig there, + Reed –
Mrs B. + I rode to Mrs Knowles' – She is very feeble.

Pleasant – went to Mr Cobbs(H.A. – to Mrs Ed. Freeman) – + took her to Chh. then to Frank Hunts + on retuig took Mrs Metcalf to Laura Stanleys – P.M. at vesty with Comtt. Mrs Babbitt + Mrs Metcalf here to dine – Mrs Bean not well –
A lovely day, and Every thing pass&ddotlow; off pleasantly at the vestry + Chh. The Confern was very interesting An abundanc of food –
I tired + Mrs B. so unwell She laid down for the Eve.
Very rainy day – till near Tea time –
I went after breakfast to Lizzie's – She is sick from her troubles P.M. I packed away furs + woolens in attic — Mrs Babbitt here P.M. for Mrs B. silk–

Cloudy — Maggry + Laby went to Tauntn Mrs B. has a cold – Dr Blake + Wife came in 1/4 of 5 Train to pass the night – He lecturd on Music (sacred) in the Siny I went but was sleepy — The Lecture was very choice

Pleasant – Mrs B. went to Bos. to Select S.S. Book Dr + Mrs Blake ret&ddotlow; in 1/4 9 Train I put chambers in order + loung. I had Bll. Suger Emptied + carried to store chamber – P.M. Slept nearly 2 hours – Geo. went with Hay to Attle. Mrs B. ret&ddotlow; at Eve.
Pleasant – Mrs B. not well + at home all day – Mr Atkinson's morng. text Psl. 90–16.17– P.M. Matt.4–23,24– I out all day + Eve + in S.S.
Rainy day – I took clothes to Bridget with Mrs Beane — Then read Morng. News – then to Desk getting off Letters + balncig[chice rend?] acts—
Had Geo. go with me to Taunton to See Lawyer about Hotel Lease – in morng. Train + home in 11–10 Train Grand ma Wild this P.M. – for N.Y. Mrs Beane very unwell —
Mrs B. + I went to Taunton in the morng. + ret&ddotlow; in 1–50 Train — to get Bonnets trim&ddotlow; Eve. Mrs B. went to Mrs Carpenters to see about Centre Burying Grd.
Lovely day – Mrs B. Miss Mellus + Self drove to Mrs Joles to Chilson's + East Mansfield –
P.M. laid down + napped – Geo. gon to Mansfield for Bed. plants –
Wm. N. White call&ddotlow; on busines Eve. went to meeting but came out before it was done –
Pleasant + hot
Miss Stickman here preparing S. S. Liby Bks – She rode with me to Sam Drapers for Keys Mrs Metcalf here with Miss S. to dine —
P.M. I went out to arrange bedding plants – After tea I calld at Mrs Elliots
Foggy morng. but cleard and becam very warm –
I was out most of the forenoon arranging the plants in Garden –
Chloe B. here to din At 1.P.M. I went + took Mrs Titus + Emily to join[?] in decorating Solders Graves—
Pleasant + warm – I went out all day –
Mr Atkinson's morng text Heb. 10"2– P.M. in Nehm. carring out the same truths –
Eve. Com&tdotlow; in Smy. Greenland –
My S. Class not as large as usual
Rainy forenon – Geo. went to Bos. in 11–20 train – Mrs Briggs here cleanig Blinds – Adams + Tom cleig out side of House – Mrs Babbitt call&draise; also Misses Carter + Mellus —
Pleasant – Mrs Bean + I went to Boston – I bot. 2 carpets – + a dress –
Home at night –
Mrs Briggs here washing Piazza Blinds + Piazza
Rainy some I left in mong for Bro. Judson went to W.R. in 10–10 Train –
Mrs Goldthwait came half hour after I ard. to visit till Monday –
Bro off all day from day to day assessing City property
Pleasant – Calld at Jennies in forenon + then walked with Mamy[?]–
P.M. calld at Mr Cowens —
Eveg. Annie G Cown called + Dr G.O.Allen –
Left Judsons at 8 + Shop&ddotlow; in Bos. till 2 – reachd hom at 3 –
Raind after I got home —
Bowel trouble thro. Saturday night Maggie went off at 9 Eve. + staid out till Sunday morng.
Rather cloudy + threatening weather – I staid at home all day on act. of my bowels –
Pleasant – Mr Boynton here whitewashing – Parlor Chamber I had that carpet taken up + gave to Geo. also Dress&Rraise; also took up sitting room carpet for Putting in Par. Chamb
Mrs Briggs here cleanig Sitting R. Pleasant – I dist[raised teddotlow] about ceiling + sent Mr Wild for the Hales to send men[?] to it – I was working hard all day on Carpets +c – So was Mrs Beane –
Pleasant – Mrs Briggs still here cleanig – 2 Masons from Tau – to Whiten the ceiling + cornice –
Mr Hagerty here painting in the room – window Sashes Mr White too is repg. Eve. Mrs Babbitt came + tried on Tamese – then Misss Mellus + Carter –
Mrs Briggs here cleanig —
very busy about Housh hold, +c
Pleasant – Mr Atkins very interesting Text Jacob wrestling with the Angel — P.M. "Fight the good" I went at Eve too.
Pleasant — I out in morng. laying out work for Carpenter – + then to Bridget P.M. I Sweeping Drawng Room morng Mr + Mrs Hale from Buffalo calld with Judith Cochran.
Rather cloudy – I went to Boston stoppig over on Train at Mansfied to get flowers for Anniver Graduates
Mrs Briggs here + cleand Ding. room
Cloudy + by turns rainy – thro. the day – toward Eve. Sun Shone – The Graduates + Mrs Metcalf here to Tea – 11 Graduates–
Very pleasant visit – Mrs Briggs here in the P.M. + Eve.
Pleasant – I rode to Ham. Arnold's and took Geo. to John Arnold's to buy "Brindle" Cow —
Had P.M. Strawberrs + Teachers to Tea – Only 5 came —
Pleasant visit
Cloudy, almost drizy + Even rainy some of the time– Geo. went to Boston to buy Hay Caps + look after Haymakers – He did'nt get any. I moved Bed into North Chamber –

Drizzly + rainy forenon Jos. Adams went Thed. Carvers – Tom + John Love – a Green Irishman cleaned cellars – P.M. I wrote Sister + the Emerson's + then Mrs B. + I drove to H. Arnolds for Strawberres –

Cloudy, drizzly day – till middle P.M. Dr Blake cam just at morng. service – His text Phillip.3–13, 14– P.M. Matt. 26"13= The latter text he analyzed + shwd why such perpetual run. Illustrating it by abstract value + moral expressin spoke of the rose bud he res&ddotlow; — The morng. it was an aimless life + one of high aims
Very warm + Suny – Began mowing clover &longequal; P.M. Mrs B. + I drove to Mansd with old tin to repair Found Wheaton Allen herre on our return

Another hot day– Took W. Allen to Depo in the morng. Mrs B. churned – then we drove to Miss Arnolds for Strawberris – Met Mrs Holman + Em. as we were going to Caleb W&sdotlow; for Jenigs – They came here to tea – After Tea Thunder Storm + Wind —

Cool + breezy – I rose Early and been busy – went to Po. Of. before breakfast with card for Sis. M. – Rec&ddotlow; a letter from her in the morng. mail – Mrs Metcalf + Miss White here to dinner – P.M. I marke&draise; towels + this morng. 25 Hay caps – Mrs John Hunt called –
Pleasant – Mrs Briggs here cleaning Refrigerator Room — Mrs B. + I about Stair carpets + connections + I went into L chambers, to put in order– –
45&th; Anniversay of my marriage –
— Geo. went to Mansfield about casting for mower – No Evg. meeting –

Cloudy morng. after rain in the night – but I went to Boston and did Sundry items of Shopping – Ret&draise; 3 P.M. with Sickhead ache– Mrs B. went H.Arnolds for Strawberres It rain&ddotlow; just as she ret&ddotlow; Graduates had a merry time planting Ivy —
Pleasant – Mrs B. Churned – + I busy marking hay Caps +c – P.M. Sent of letters +c
Nellie came at Eve.

Lovely day – I wnt for Mrs Knowls in the morng. + took her to Church – Mr At. preached a baccalaureate to the Grad. Class Text that our Daughtes may be as clean[?] stones polishd +c Excellent – P.M. text 1 Cor. 14–20 C.C. good Mrs B. went out at Eve.

very hot day – Mrs B. clump&ddotlow; butter + made cake – I was on the alert all day – went to Bridget in morng. to P.O. + Mrs Babbitts – P.M. at 3 – teachers came in to consult I then went for strawberries–

Cool + comfortable We went into Examination in fornoon but P.M. I felt So languid did not go in – I drov with Mrs B. to H. Arnolds for Strawberis – Mrs Emsom came at noon. Mary Chapin came at night.
[underline to separate entries]
Lovely, cool day – 11 Graduates — Ella Sterns stopping with Mary –here– I went to Bd. H. to Dine – Every thing passd off pleasantly I was present at the AlumnaeAllm meeting —
Mrs Metcalf here to tea —
cool, comfortable day – Clouds at Ev + thunder + lightng M. Chapin off on a picknic –
I took Ellen Sterns to mong. Train + then went for Strawberies taking Mrs B. + Miss Carter P.M. I went to Chh. Meeting – Mr Alkinson com– his desire to withdrw after 3 mos.
Cloudy morng. but cleard – I went to Bos. with Nillie Beane + did business + home in 3 Train – Mary Chapin left in 11 Train for hom – after tea Mrs Metcalf Nellie Plympton + Miss Mellus called –
I work&ddotlow; at my Desk after getting hom to Settle with my workmen–
Cloudy + morng drizzly I at desk forenoon + a part of P.M. — Vry still day for the 4&th; – Several of the men in the Hay field –

Raind last night + by spells thro. the day – Small congregation – morg Mr Alkinson read part of a Sermon by Rev. Dr Huntington on 1 Cor. 1–26 f.C."for ye see your calling Bretheren." P.M. Rom. 15– 5,6,7 v – I think after wh. com. Serms I was strangely stupid + sleepy.
Nellie went with me to Boston + back I retd in 3 Train– and packed for leavig hom tomorrow Nellie went for Bos. to Worcester—
Warm – Left with Mrs Bean for Prov in 11=23 train at Barrows Vill – then to Ux at 3–10 – passd night ther
In night thunder storm + rain –
Pleasant – took cars at 6–55 for Worces at 10 to Bos. Expre Trns for Saratoga via Alby Skenctady – ard. at Sar. at 6. took Rooms at Dr Strogs 94 No – A delightfu ride –
Stomy – didnt go to Chh–
Left Saratoga for Lake George – By R.R. to Glen's Falls – then 9 mls to Lake Geroge – stopd at the Ft Wm. Heny Hotel
Took Steam up Lake G. 36 mls – then Stag. 4 mls to "Old Tic" – Dined – at 1 took S. Champlan to Burlington –
Left Burlington at 8 – cam to Fitchburg + passd the night —
Left Fitchburg in 8–55 train + reached hom at 12–10 – after a delightful trip of 10 days –
Floren came last night –

Busy – at 3 went for Ellen Bean at Depot then for wash – a call from Mr Marshal Snow – I gave him with Misses Mellus + Carter seat in the carriage to Barrows ville – then to H. Arn then to Sam. Drapes + Dea. Blandin's – about calling Chh. meeting –
Pleasant – Mr Atkinson's morng text Matt. 7"21–23– P.M. Kings How long halt ye betwen two op. +c – vry good –

Rather Cloudy – after Breakfast went to BrgEts with wash – At 11–23 took Cars for Prov. Bot May 2 Dresses and cash&ddotlow; P.O. order fr. Mrs Hallely[?] for the Parson Sisters. Rode to Mr Messengers with Grapes –
Eve. at Desk –
Warm– Ema Sherm came in morng. + Hattie Pain in 3 Train —
D.D.Sinclar calld to look at Portraits
Pleasant + warm– I very busy—
P.M. took Hattie, Em +Nellie + drove out on Sundry Errand to Mr Husseys – Lucy McCabes +c —
Eve Sevral lady callrs
Went to Boston – Mrs Beane + Ellen A. Rogerson went with me – I gave the managers a Powr or Bis for Ellen to go to my vault– + they remain irresponsib for any of her acts –
Pleasant – Hattie + Ema left this morng. I then went to Mansfield with Ellen + Flo. caled at Mrs Ide's on the parsons sister + got tin that was left to repair –
Another pleasant day – After breakfast rode to Bridgets + Mrs Macomber's
Pleasant – Mr Atkinson preachd at noon we had a Chh. meeting in the vestry in reference to Mr Atkinson's Resignatn + Cong. Singing
I was trying in reference to its result – the meeting adjournd to Monday Eve.
Sam. Draper, Miss Carter + myself chosen a comtt. [Monday 27 dateline here] to present Resolutions to Mr At– We went Sab. Eve.
[underline to separate]
Pleasant – We are pressing ford. in our prearation for Compton–
Eve. went to adjournd Chh. At first things looked dark – but a Spirit of conciliaton prevailed and wonderful harmony –
Pleasant–
Cloudy morng. + threatening weather. about noon it began to rain + cont&ddotlow; thro. P.M. + past midnigh
H.A.Cobb. came to get final instruction in rep&gdotlow; Seminy + I settled with my farmers – + tried to get ready to leav in the morng. if fair weather. Mary C. ar&ddotlow; at Eve.

Morng. bright + lovely – Misses Mellus + Carter came to breakfast after wh. they with Flo. + Nell. Beane + M.A.Chapin + Cook[?] tooks cars for Little Compton – and at noon Mrs B. + I left with Blky in Buggy carryall – Enrout for Compt. Maggy was to leav at 1 1/2

Pleasant – we spent the night at Fall River 25 mls fr. N. having come thro. Berkly + Assonet. at 8 this morng. we renewed our joury + reached our old House at the Grinnels at 1– delightd to reach here. We are very happy here
– I am not feeling quite well.
Pleasant morng. but toward – noon it began to cloud up – Some of the Ladies drove out with Blacky in forenon Had Tatog for diner
Sat. Eve. it rained hard and thunder + lighting—
Pleasant day till near 5 P.M. when a little cloud came up, and wet Mary + I as we were on the rocks – the 6 ladies of our party went to meeting in forenoon —
Eve. Mr + Mrs Grinel + Warren came in
Pleasant day – In forenoon I drov out Blky. with 3 of the party – to the common –
P.M. Beanes went to the Shore rocks.
Eve. a letter from Bro. Austin asking for 335.44 be loaned him for Pren. on Life Policies –
Pleasant – rode at 7 1/2 to Common with Nellie + Mrs Beane – Nell to take Stage for Boston + I to get letters into mail
Pleasant – after Tea rode to Common for Mail + found Nellie + brot. her home with us – Flo. went to Social Aid at Chh. –
Pleasant– till P.M when we had a little Shower –
After tea we rode to Common – – – + got the mail – To day settled up Grocery &account; + with W. Kempton – Eve. read Beechr– Tilton scandal –
Mrs Beane comd. her supervision for Tea– for 1 week.
Pleasant + milder – after breakfast Miss Carter, Nell + M.A.C. rode with me to J Brownell's Beach in Co. with the Brown's from Cin. + Prov.
A powerful rainy day – waves high – we went to warren observatory — We read John Halifax by Miss Mulk –
Eve. Warren called Nell stay&ddotlow; to Grin&sdotlow; to tea –
Rainy by spells – Men from Either House went to Chh. P.M. we went to Beach. Waves grand – –
We had a sermon read by Mrs Bean – otherwise Each did their own reading – Eve. Mrs G.W + Wife called—
Bright – + hot sun. I took Nellie to Com. to go to Marlboro. Mrs B. went with me.
Went by way of Swamp after tea with Florence to Engage a wash woman – Saw her at Mr Brownells –
Pleasant and warm –
Bathed in P.M. Then went with Floren Before tea for Ellen Went via of Swamp and Mrs Metcalf + Susie – only got Nellie –
Cloudy + Sultry – We all went to Clam Bake – I went befor tea again for Mrs Metcalf + S. and after waiting more then an hour with Mrs Beane came home with out the lady + Miss[??] –
Pleasant –
Bathed in P.M. with Mrs B.
I did not drive Blky. to day —
Drizzly rainy forenn P.M. Misses Mellus + C. drove with me to Butcher' + store Mrs Metcalf + Susie came at Eve –
Drov to P.O. about Tea time – called at Wash womans – + Mr Seabury's for a Mr Rodman –
Pleasant – we all went to Chh. but Miss Carter + Susie Mr Rice preached "Let the beauty of the Lord be upon us." feeble sermon.
We bathed in the P.M.
Pleasant –
We had a nice Bath – the best of the Season – P.M. we drove to common – had a time with the cattle at old House –
Rose Early to go for wash woman – – + to Post Office – – I very tired – bathed in P.M. –
Eve. called at Mr Grinnels – –
Warm day – I took Mrs Metcalf, Susie + Miss Mellus to Clam Bake Methodists – Nice time
Pleasant – Bathed – Mrs Beane has very bad headache —
P.M. Set out to drive out with Mrs Metcalf + Mellus but found the Wind Mills goig + took different drive – Miss Carter quite feeble – Young Ladies playd croquete with Gent. in our yard –

div.opener:
96d in shade in morng.
Friday, August 21, 1874.
div.p: Took Ellen + Mary to Common for Stage one to Hopkinton + the other to Boston – to see about schools – very warm day –
We bathed in morg –
Letter fr.Martha + Mrs Wild–
We were distressed by Eve. mail that brot. Moulton's statements on the Beecher Scandal
Pleasant – most of us went to Chh. I went to Methodist + heard Mr Patterson the Pastor – Text Luk 19&th; 41+42&vraise;
Eve. Mrs Beane went to 3d Service –
Pleasant– I drove Early in morng. to Franklin Wilburs – with 3 of our ladies.
P.M. I bathed – wavs Strong–
The Ladies busy cooking for Pic Nic–
Pleasant – We all rose by 5 or thereabouts – and at 6 1/2 Eight of the Ladis Set out for the Breakwater to take sloop for Gay Head – with Excursionists – I took 3 of them –
P.M. Cook + I went to to P.O. + Store –
Pleasant but cool Some of the party tired —
P.M. Mrs B. + Met. + Mellus rode with me to make calls + P.O. Got letter from for Mary – + she packed to leave in the morng.
Pleasant but cool – Dear Mary Chapin left Early for Stage Enroute for Home via Fall R. + Bristol R.R.
Mrs Metcalf + Flo. I took up to Com for Stage – Mr Grinnell took the Bgy.
We had Warrn + May + Sophra[?] Kempton to Tea –
We went to Chh. most of us. Rev Mr Staples of Prov. Uni. preach a refreshing Ser. Behold the lilts of the valley +c. Mr + Mrs Grinel in to Tea —
P.M. We went to the Rocks —
Pleasant – all vry busy breaking up to leave tomorrw Susie Plymton + Nellie stop a little longer at the Grinels
Cloudy + warm – Geo. went to Newprt with Mr Tucker.
I rode round Bridgets at noon + we stop at cottage to dine also went with Mrs to Tea –
Drizzly a little —
Still Coudey + warm Mrs Briggs here to help about tomatoes + P.Peaches – I went alone to Cot. to dine I rec&ddotlow; letters from Sis. M. + Lizzie Tubbs – Both To cot. to tea.
Cloudy + drizzly Wm. Hale came from Taunton to see about Parsonage cellar – Mr Wild busy looking after improvments to be made.
We went to Cot. for all our D. + T. meals to day –
Bridget call&ddotlow; + I paid her
Still drizzly–
Showr bath Sprang aleak – Mr Wild went to Taunton P.M. to buy Cement for Par. Cellar –
An awful fire in Fall Rivr – Granite Mill burnt + perished –
To Cot. all the meals
Drizzly day – I did not go to Chh. but we took our 3 meals at cottage retuing at Eve Step&ddotlow; into the Freems

Clead off cooler – I not as well – Plumbers here on cistern Leak – A wearisom day – Dear Lizzie Tubbs + Daughter came in noon Train + left in 1/4 of 5 Train – Dind at Hotel – A letter from Maggie saying she is'nt coming –
Pleasant + cool – I some better – + went to Cottage to breakfast – Din&ddotlow; at home – Mr Tripp had paralysis this morng. I rode to the gate –
P.M. drove with Mrs Beane to McCabe the[overwritten] the Cottagers drov Bly – Mrs Metcalf call&ddotlow; Eve. I not so well
Beautiful day – but I am feeble –
Maggie came –
Nisterns + Yuccas to West Roxbury —
P.M. Judson came – I rod out with him –
Eve. Sis. Mary cam
Geo. to Taunton
Mrs Beane + Ellen R. went to Boston
Geo. to Taunton
ShowerSho Early mild Sis. M. left 10 of 8 – for Home by Lane's Depot –
Mr Tripp died at 11 1/2 last night
Mr Tripp buried to day – 83 yrs.
In mid Train Left with Mrs Bea for Clarndon Hotel Boston – Room 8 – Geo. went with us.
Took first sitting of Dr. Garrat –
Lovely day – We rode out in Horse Cars in forenoon —
2d visit to Dr Garrat
Lovely day —
Judson calld in the morng. after wh. Mrs B. + I rode out —
P.M. Mrs B. went again –
To Dr Garratt's + then rode to Waren St. on Shawnnt Av Cars —
To U.S. Sub. Treas.
cold–
cold– went to Dr Garratts + Winter St —
cold— went to Dr Clarke's
Pleasant– I went to Dr G's + took carraig to [something overwritten or crossed out] Svg Bdnk – + Boylston Bk.
Lizzie Wild calld in the morng.
Geo. came in on my R.R. busins
out to ride with Mrs B. rather late + walkd too far at Eve –
Judson calld – goes to Ux. this P.M. Adol. vry sick –
I went to Dr Garratt—
Mrs Metcalf came to dine with us.
Sister Ema + Anie calld – Bro. Adol is very sick –
went to Dr Garrat's —
I not as well as usual – + kept in doors –
Geo. came in on R.R. matters
Storm – Did'nt go out –
Pleasant – went to Dr G's + came hom
vry tired –
Not so well – Chilly –
Kept house – Mrs Bean left for Worcestr —
Thankving – alone with Maggie – Rode out 1 1/2 hous
Pleasant – P.M. Mrs Metcalf called —
Pleasant– rode out 1 1/2 hours with Geo. + Lizzie – to Harveys – Daln Cobbs +c.
Pleasant
Rode P.M. 2 hous with Geo. + Lizzie to Winncunet –
Rainy – + noon windy + tore off our patnt chimny top –
Miss Mellus + Carter called just before night .
Pleasant + cold – I walkd out in St. in fornn –
P.M. rode with Geo.+ Lizzie 2 hours Misss M. + Carter calld in morng. Eve. Mrs Metcalf calld–
8–clk 14 a.0 – very cold Pleasant. Geo. went to Boston – about chimy top –
P.M. Miss Carter rode with me to Mansfield – Ben. Briggs drove –
A letter from Sister Adol. more comfot
Mrs B. ret&ddotlow; at Eve.
Alfred S. Tubbs came at Eve. from Cambridge —
Maggie went to metig
I still at home from feeble ness–
Alfred ret&ddotlow; in mid train —
Mrs Beane went to Boston in Early train to do X shopping for me —
Ret&ddotlow; at Ev – Lizzie rode with me + Geo.
Mrs Rogerson call&ddotlow;
A little flurry of snow – in morng.
H. A. Cobb cam in to sette P.M. Mrs B. + Mry rode with me around Winnecunet Pond –
Misses Carter + Mellus rode with us P.M to Mansfield —
Leaden sky till now when it began snowing – + contd an hour or so. I still at home from Chh. Mrs Metcalf calld
Mrs Beane sick with cold –
very cold — Trustees met – Semy. closed its Fall term – Mr Emerson here to dine – Mrs Met. to tea—
Misses Mellus + Cater her to tea – after riding with us
Misses Mellus + C. here to breakfast –
Mrs Beane gone went to Boston in first train
[little underline to separate] Jan 16&th; Miss Herald pd. for 74+75 Amer. + Forg. C. world pd. for till 1878 – five years from Jany. 1. 1873 —
Saml. B. Capron died Jany. 4– 1874 in Hartford agd 41–
Jany. 17&th; Williams Keith died ag°dotlow; 83 and for more then 40 years a member of our Church.

Rosey McCabe Cronan died Feb. 18&th; 11 1/2 clk morng. Leaving an infant dughter born 30&th; Janydays old — at North Dighton – Rosy was a faithful + beloved Servant in my family for 9 years – She married 22d Oct. 1871 Patrick Cronan

text.back:
Memoranda
Dr Hersey Baylies 1874 Feb. 17 Dr Hersey Baylies died from dry motifycatin beginning in too
Mrs Seabuy Lane Mar. 7&th; Mrs Seabuy Lane died – Daug. of Rewel Robinson
>Charles Sumner Mar. 11. Charles Sumner died at his residence in Washington at 3 P.M. of Heart disease – He was in his Seat in the Senate the P.M. before – He was 63 yers old last Jany. 6&th; being born " " 1822–
Memoranda
May 16&th; Saturday Resorvirs in Gushr broke[?] Wmsburg + Hayden vill + other places were deluged + nearly 200 persons lost their lives –
Calvin Hunt Tuesday May 12&thx; Calvin Hunt was buried on Tuesday May 12&thx; He was injured in the autumn by the falling of a tree –
Mrs Banister May 30&th; Mrs Banister 80 years old to day –
Memoranda
1874 May 16&th; about 7 in the morig. a mighty Resovir above William's burg – Berkshire Co. broke and a volum of water more than 30 ft. high came taring down thro. Wmburg + some 3 village below carring destruction + death in all it track – about 200 person perished by the flood – It was awful – + without warning to the people –
Memoranda
Fannie W. Holmes 1874 Jun 5 or 6 Fannie W. Holmes died and at Canton at her Brother's House – + remains taken on the 8&th; to New Bed + the funeral was in the Pacific Chh. Mrs Metcal went to the funeral 28 yrs of age.
Mr Tripp Nov 2d Mr Tripp died last night
&ebwdiaback;
